Package othello

Class Board

java.lang.Object
othello.Board
public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
Board is the logical representation of a game of Othello. A Board object is characterized by an 8x8 grid where Discs can be placed. When a Disc is played onto the board, the board updates and switches other Discs on the board as per the rules of Othello. The board class keeps track of player turn and alternates it each time a Disc is placed.
See Also:
Disc

  • Field Details

    • tiles

      private Disc[][] tiles
      The logical representation of the 8x8 grid that contains the discs placed by the players.
      See Also:
      placeDisc(Coordinate)

    • playerTurn

      private java.awt.Color playerTurn
      Keeps track of whose turn it is. The playerTurn variable can either be Black or White. Each time a new Disc is placed the playerTurn will alternate.
      See Also:
      placeDisc(Coordinate), switchTurn()

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      Constructor for the Board Class. Calls the initTiles method to instantiate the tiles object. Sets the starting player to Black
      See Also:
      tiles, initTiles(), playerTurn

  • Method Details

    • initTiles

      private Disc[][] initTiles()
      Sets the board to its starting state.

      This method creates an 8x8 grid, using a 2d othello.Disc array, and fills the center 4 positions/tiles with Discs of alternating colors (White, Black) such that each color is diagonal to itself. E.g. WB/BW. The pattern starts at (3,3) with white. Used for the instantiation of the tiles object in the Board constructor.
      Returns:
      2d Disc array of size 8x8 with the center four tiles filled with Discs of alternating colors
      See Also:
      tiles, Board(), Disc

    • getTiles

      public Disc[][] getTiles()
      Returns:
      2d Disc array (8x8)
      See Also:
      tiles

    • getPlayerTurn

      public java.awt.Color getPlayerTurn()
      Returns:
      A Color, either black or white depending on whose turn it is
      See Also:
      playerTurn

    • getPlayableTiles

      public java.util.ArrayList<Coordinate> getPlayableTiles()
      Calculates which positions on the board can be played based on whose turn it currently is. A tile is playable if it can create a straight line between it and an already played Disc with at least one Disc of the opposite color in that line.
      Returns:
      an arrayList of coordinates at which it is legal to place a Disc
      See Also:
      Coordinate, playerTurn

    • switchTurn

      private void switchTurn()
      Switches whose turn it is.

      The turn alternates between black and white. I.e. if black then white and vice versa. The change is kept track by the playerTurn object. This method is called at the end of the placeDisc method.
      See Also:
      playerTurn, placeDisc(Coordinate)

    • placeDisc

      public void placeDisc​(Coordinate coordinate)
      Places a Disc onto the board and correspondingly flips other Discs to the placed Disc's color and then switches the turn.

      Creates a new othello.Disc whose color is determined by the playerTurn object in the tiles array at the position specified by the x and y values of the coordinate parameter. Then searches in 8 directions to find a line between the placed Disc and another Disc of the same color, if a compatible line if found then all Discs in that line (excluding the start and end positions) are flipped. Then calls the switchTurn method.
      Parameters:
      coordinate - the location a Disc is to be placed at
      See Also:
      Disc, tiles, switchTurn()

    • getDiscCount

      public int[] getDiscCount()
      Counts the number of Black Discs and the number of White Discs on the board.
      Returns:
      an int array, the first element corresponding to the amount of Black Discs and the second to the number of White
